Package fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.saarimarko.util

Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.saarimarko.util.Arrays
public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
This Class contains array related methods. This class was made for school project and is quite limited in usability.
Author:
Marko Saari

    Arrays()

    Tells how many numbers the two arrays have in common Returned number and arrays are all of integer type.

    Removes selected index from the given array array and index both need to be of integer type.

    Changes String array into int array All of the contents in the given array have to be convertable into integers.

  • Constructor Details

    • Arrays

      public Arrays()

  • Method Details

    • hasDublicate

      public static boolean hasDublicate​(int[] array)
      tells if the given array contains dublicate numbers.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is to being checked
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the array has dublicates

    • areInRange

      public static boolean areInRange​(int[] array, int min, int max)
      tells if numbers are in the defined range of values. this function returns either true of false depending on given array and values.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is to being checked
      min - determines the smallest passable value
      max - determines the largest passable value
      Returns:
      a boolean that tells if the array has numbers that are too big or small

    • toIntArray

      public static int[] toIntArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
      Changes String array into int array All of the contents in the given array have to be convertable into integers.
      Parameters:
      array - the array that is to be changed into int type array
      Returns:
      the resulting int type array

    • contains

      public static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
      Checks if the given value exists in the given array. Number and array are both of integer type. Method stops upon finding the value or at the end of the array.
      Parameters:
      value - the integer that the method tries to find
      array - the array that is being searched
      Returns:
      tells whether or not the integer was found

    • hitAmount

      public static int hitAmount​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      Tells how many numbers the two arrays have in common Returned number and arrays are all of integer type. Size of the arrays doesn't matter. Arrays need to contain uniquie values or method doesn't work properly. Works with arrays of all sizes without requiring their sizes to be even.
      Parameters:
      array1 - the first array that contains unique integers
      array2 - the second array
      Returns:
      returns the number of pairs

    • removeIndex

      public static int[] removeIndex​(int[] original, int index)
      Removes selected index from the given array array and index both need to be of integer type. note that indexes start from 0.
      Parameters:
      original - original array
      index - the index which we want to remove
      Returns:
      returns the new array
